intro: Exacum quinquenervium, commonly known as the five-veined African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, often with a contrasting color at the base. Its leaves are typically rounded and slightly hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soil with indirect sunlight. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
